After installation, you should apply fix from folder Fix/fxbox_fix.exe. This one remove protection called "Demo Stuff" from FX BOX. Then you can run program.

i get a message saying error opening wav device sample rate not supported.  How do i fix this and what kind of cabl do i connect my guitar to the computer with? thanx in advance
Try change sample rate in settings. To connect guitar use standard cable with you connecing guitar to power amp. In sound card install jack-minijack converter (connect it to microphone or line-in).
Anybody has a crack to version 2.7?
i have vista too and it works fine

It works on Vista too!

1.: Right click on the shortcut -> Properties -> Compatibility
2.: Select Run with the following compatibility mode: Windows XP (Service Pack 2), then click OK
3.: Run the program, go in to Setup -> Advanced
4.: Change the Input and Output operation mode to Compatibility and disable the Conpensate sample rate differences option
5.: In the Setup menu for the I/O Devices I recommend for the Input: Line-In / Output: Speakers

Note: If you hear clips or pops, just click on Stop and Start again, or Restart the program.

My config: Vista SP1, Integrated Realtek HD Audio (ALC662) - Driver version R2.31, Eko S300 E-Guitar (Stratocaster shape, Sunburst color)
